channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: CONTAINED Brush Fire; INC#0028; 12:52AM; 12737 Lopez Canyon Rd In Laco; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; The first 16 LAFD firefighters, along with LACoFD, stopped all forward progress of the quarter-acre fire in 28 minutes from the time of alarm. No reported injuries. Crews will remain on scene to continue to chase down hot spots in the burned area, and fortify perimeter lines.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 CM40 CM42 E24 E275 E298 E7 E75 E77 E8140 E90 E91 E98 EM15 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA98 T75 T98 WT77; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#0028; 12:24AM; 12737 Lopez Canyon Rd In Laco; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; Quarter-acre of medium-to-heavy brush burning uphill with light wind. No structures threatened. LAFD and LACoFD are in unified command, each sending full brush assignments.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 CM40 CM42 E24 E275 E298 E7 E75 E77 E8140 E90 E91 E98 EM15 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA98 T75 T98 WT77; CH5; 17; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1273; 05:44PM; 7944 N Sale Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46AiUnE; #WestHills; Firefighters found a one-story single-family home engulfed in flames, with reports of several people home at the time of the blaze. All three occupants evacuated prior to LAFD arrival. Firefighters quickly deployed hose lines to attack the fire inside and protect the nearby threatened building, while others ascended ladders to perform ventilation on the roof (to allow smoke and super-heated gases to escape and make it more tenable for fire crews below). It took 25 firefighters 18 minutes to extinguish the flames. All three occupants were assessed by paramedics and, thankfully, some only had minor complaints due to smoke and elected not to go to the hospital. Cause under investigation.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC17 E105 E106 E305 E72 EM17 RA105 RA106 T105; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1273; 05:26PM; 7944 N Sale Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46AiUnE; #WestHills; One-story single-family home with heavy fire showing, and nearby structure(s) threatened.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC17 E105 E106 E305 E72 RA106 T105; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Rubbish Fire; INC#0209; 04:42AM; 13901 W Polk St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3XJgOOb; #Sylmar; Four firefighters (one fire engine) responded to reports of a rubbish fire in front of a church. Upon arrival, firefighters found the flames to be out (and a garden house on the ground nearby), and only smoldering wood remained. Due to the location being a house of worship, per protocol, LAPD and LAFD investigators were notified, and the cause is under investigation.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AR11 AR25 E91; CH8; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0262; 05:52AM; 8304 S Broadway St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pCj39u; #Florence; Twenty-six LAFD firefighters extinguished flames in a 20' x 60' one-story commercial building (site of a previous burn). Firefighters began in defensive operations, knocked down the bulk of the intense flames, and transitioned to an offensive attack to complete the suppression efforts in 20 minutes (6:12am). No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 E233 E264 E33 E46 E64 RA57 RA846 T33 T64; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

CONTAINED Brush Fire; INC#0924; 12:40PM; 451 W Av 37; MAP: https://bit.ly/3NI58H1; #MountWashington; Firefighters extinguished the fire (in mostly dry grass) in 15 minutes, holding it to less than one-half of an acre. We thank the residents that helped to slow the progress with garden hoses, prior to LAFD arrival. No reported injuries. No structures damaged. Cause under investigation.; FS 44; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E12 E201 E212 E250 E290 E44 E47 E55 EM1 H3 H4 HA3 HA4 T1 T12 T90; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#0924; 12:25PM; 3931 N West Point Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/46EsINB; #MountWashington; Approximately one-quarter acre of light/flashy fuels (ignites easily and burns quickly) burning uphill, with light wind. ; FS 44; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC2 E1 E12 E201 E212 E250 E290 E44 E55 EM1 H0C H0F T1 T12 T90; CH5; 12; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0006; 12:26AM; 1758 W 65th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/43i60rn; Harvard Park; The first 20 firefighters arrived and quickly extinguished the outside fire exposing a liquor store and a residential building, in 24 minutes, limiting the nearby buildings only minor exterior damage. Nothing further.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 BC11 E226 E233 E26 E46 E66 E94 RA266 RA66 RA866 T26 T33; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0006; 12:02AM; 1758 W 65th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/43i60rn; #HarvardPark; Outside fire exposing a commercial building and a single-family home (which has smoke coming from the attic). Offensive mode.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC1 E226 E26 E66 E94 RA66 RA866 T26; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange
